articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Settlement shows how Trump lawyers crafted plan for fake electors to file papers falsely saying he won Wisconsin in 2020.
articles.title: Settlement shows how Trump lawyers crafted plan for fake electors to file papers falsely saying he won Wisconsin in 2020

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court on Monday unanimously restored Donald Trump to 2024 presidential primary ballots, rejecting state attempts to ban the Republican former president over the Capitol riot.
articles.title: Supreme Court restores Trump to ballot, rejecting state attempts to ban him over Capitol attack

articles.author: SOPHIA TAREEN
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Two attorneys for then-President Donald Trump orchestrated a plan for fake electors to file paperwork falsely saying the Republican won Wisconsin in a strategy to overturn Joe Biden’s 2020 victory there and in other swing states, according to a lawsuit settlement reached Monday that makes public months of texts and emails.
articles.title: Settlement in Wisconsin fake elector case offers new details on the strategy by Trump lawyers

articles.author: DREW CALLISTER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Omar Abu Kuwaik is far from his home in Gaza. The 4-year-old's parents and sister were killed by an Israeli airstrike, when he lost part of his arm. He’s one of the lucky ones.
articles.title: A 4-year-old Gaza boy lost his arm – and his family. Half a world away, he’s getting a second chance

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI and SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris on Monday is hosting a member of Israel’s wartime Cabinet who is visiting Washington in defiance of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
articles.title: Harris will meet with Israeli Cabinet official who is in Washington despite Netanyahu's rebuke

articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Allen Weisselberg, the former chief financial officer of Donald Trump's company, pleaded guilty Monday in New York to perjury in connection with testimony he gave in the ex-president’s civil fraud case.
articles.title: Former Trump CFO Allen Weisselberg pleads guilty to perjury in ex-president’s civil fraud case

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and AMELIA THOMSON-DEVEAUX
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A poll finds that a significant share of U.S. adults doubt the mental capabilities of 81-year-old President Joe Biden and 77-year-old Donald Trump, the former president and current Republican front-runner in what could be a rematch of the 2020 election.
articles.title: 6 in 10 US adults doubt mental capability of Biden and Trump, AP-NORC poll finds

articles.author: KELVIN CHAN
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — The European Union leveled its first antitrust penalty against Apple on Monday, fining the U.S. tech giant nearly $2 billion for unfairly favoring its own music streaming service by forbidding rivals like Spotify from telling users how they could pay for cheaper subscriptions outside of iPhone apps.
articles.title: Apple gets fined nearly $2 billion by the EU for hindering music streaming competition

articles.author: EVENS SANON and PIERRE-RICHARD LUXAMA
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — Authorities in Haiti have ordered a nighttime curfew after an explosion of violence when gang gunmen overran the two biggest prisons and freed thousands of inmates over the weekend.
articles.title: Haiti orders a curfew after gangs overrun its two largest prisons. Thousands have escaped

articles.author: DAVID KOENIG and MICHELLE CHAPMAN
articles.description: JetBlue Airways and Spirit Airlines are ending their proposed $3.8 billion merger weeks after a federal judge blocked the the deal, saying it would hurt consumers who depend on Spirit's lower fares.
articles.title: JetBlue and Spirit are ending their $3.8 billion merger plan after a federal judge blocked the deal
